San Francisco, CA

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the president of the CFCP: info@ChaparralPoets.org PO Box 1161 Modesto, CA, 95353-1161
did.abstract: The California Federation of Chaparral Poets, Inc. (CFCP) records reflect the administration and events of CFCP, one of the oldest and largest organizations in the world that supports and encourages the creation and celebration of poetry. The collection contains the minutes of their Board, annual convention programs, contest publications and member publications. Their annual poetry contests, conventions and publications are filled with the best of California poetry and the poetry of the world.

p.emph: A copy of this collection guide is located in an unnumbered folder at the front of Box 1.

accessrestrict.head: Access:
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research with no restrictions.

accruals.head: Accruals:
accruals.p: Additional materials may be added to this collection as donations are received.

relatedmaterial.head: Additional Materials:
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections of materials are housed at Glendale, CA Public Library as well as the California State Library in Sacramento, CA.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights:
userestrict.p: Use of the materials is governed by all applicable copyright law. CFCP reserves the right to restrict any materials from reproduction at any time. Property rights reside with the CFCP. Literary rights are retained by the creators of the records and their heirs. For permission to reproduce or to publish, please contact CFCP.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Suggested citation of these records is: CFCP1, California Federation of Chaparral Poets Records.

arrangement.head: Organization:
arrangement.p: The collection is organized in 15 series, with subseries or file subarrangements where appropriate.

defitem.label: Series XIII.
defitem.item: Assorted CFCP and CFCP Chapter Books and Pamphlets

bioghist.head: History of the California Federation of Chaparral Poets, Inc.
bioghist.p: The story of Chaparral began in 1939 when the city of Glendale organized its First Annual Festival of Arts. The Poetry Committee’s display included a brochure, “In the Chaparral.”
On February 9, 1940, the Glendale Poetry Chapter was formed, followed in March by the Pasadena Poetry Club. From these two groups CFCP was organized.

The first convention was held in 1940 at the Glendale YWCA, with more than 300 attending. By January 1942, the Federation had grown to 11 Chapters across southern California, and continued to experience steady growth throughout the state.

By 1963, when the convention was held in Sacramento, CFCP had become the largest poetry group in the world, with 30 chapters from both northern and southern California, as well as members from more than a dozen other states. Since then, the convention generally alternates between northern and southern host Chapters. It presently has 19 active Chapters.

bioghist.head: The Name
bioghist.p: Symbolically the name ‘Chaparral’ was chosen because it is typically Californian, as the low growth of chaparral that covers the hillsides and desert wastes of California, adding beauty and fragrance to barren countrysides, might be applied to poetry singing its way into a war-torn and barren world today.

p.emph: —from the program of the Third Annual Convention, held in May, 1942 in Hollywood

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: More information may be found about CFCP in the following publication: California Federation of Chaparral Poets (2012). Chaparral Updrafts. Modesto: California Federation of Chaparral Poets

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: Box and Folder numbers in bold.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains job descriptions of organization officers, all meeting minutes as well as records of all meetings, both in person and online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains job descriptions of organization officers, all meeting minutes as well as records of all meetings, both in person and online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to the promotional/informational brochure, including the artwork used for the publication

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains copies of organizational By-Laws and records pertaining to incorporation of the CFCP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains records pertaining to the California State Library, the planned deposit of the CFCP Archives to the California State Library and related information

did.unittitle: California State Library correspondence and information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains records pertaining to both past and present Chapters of the CFCP, including newsletters, membership rosters and other administrative and poetry activities. Records have been separated into separate folders for those Chapters that have enough records to merit this treatment. For all other chapters where minimal records are available, they have been collated alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series encompasses all available materials regarding annual contest planning, advertising, and entries. It does not include publications, which are gathered with other publications in Series XII.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains pertinent records and available copies of programs for the annual CFCP convention.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains all correspondence of a general nature not directly related to other series in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains general administrative and subject files. Please see folder titles for specific content descriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series contains This series contains materials from allied poetry organizations, some of which share members with CFCP.

did.unittitle: Assorted CFCP and CFCP Chapter Books and Pamphlets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series consists of all CFCP and cFCP Chapter Publications except Convention Programs, which are filed with their annual Convention materials under Series VII. Manuals or scrapbooks are not included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of all available Adult Poetry Contest winner publications. The name of the publication varies over the years. Titles have been taken directly from publication.

did.unittitle: Prize Winning and Honorable Mention Poems - 1965 California Poetry Competition, Sponsored by CFCP
Wings of Pegasus - 1966 California Poetry Competition, Sponsored by CFCP

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of all available Youth Contest winner publications. The name of the publication varies over the years. Titles have been taken directly from publication.

did.unittitle: Winning poems - high school contests, 1971 California Poetry Competition
Winners, Junior and Senior High School Contest

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content:
scopecontent.p: This series consists of individual publications by member poets or publications in which CFCP member poets' work appear.

list.head: Angilly, Richard
Cole, Eddie-Lou
list.item:
Eddie-Lou Cole was a Chaparral poet for many years and a member of the Tumbleweed Chapter. Her work has been featured in many poetry publications and anthologies around the world. Some of these journals and her poems are listed here for your convenience:
Ekphrasis: A Poetry Journal
Gusto
Haiku Journal
Spring Blossoms, 1990
Daughters of Eve, 2003
Lines in the Sand
Unforgivin, 2001
The Door Ajar, 2008
